div.head: Robert Perkins. Will
div.p:
In the name of God Amen, the thirteenth day of December in the
year of out Lord One Thousand six hundred and sixty eight I Robert Perkins
of Port Tobacco in Charles County and province of maryland planter being
sick in body but of good and heartful mind & memory thanks bee to–
Almighty God and calling to remembrance the uncertains Estate of this
hamsitory life and that all flesh must yield unto Death when it
shall please God to call make constitute Ordaine– I Declare this
my last will and Testament in manner and form I allowing working
and anulling by these presents all and Testament and Testament
will and wills heretofore by me made and declared either by word or
writinge and this is to be taken only for my last will and Testament & more
other. And first being pertinent and for my from the Bottom of my heart–
for my sins past most humbly desireing forgiven ef for the same
I give & commit my soule unto almighty God my savior and Redeemer
and by the of Jesus Christ and believe afsoundly to be saved and
to have full and forgivenly of all my sins and that my soule with
my body at the General day of nesumelion shall rise again with joy.
and though the merits of Christ Death I - I inherit the
Kingdom of heaven for his Estate and Chosen and my body to be
buried in such I where it shall please my Executor hereafter
to appoint and now for this settling of my Temporal Estate and such
good Chattle, & debts aside hath pleased God for above my deserts to
bestow
Bestow upon me & I doe ordain gove and dis the same in manner &
form following that is to say First I will that all Debts & duties
as I awe in rights on to any ammer of person on persons whatsoever
shall be well and truly contented and paid with in convenient time
after my deceased by my Executor hereafter named
Item I doe hereby make and ordain my dear and loving wife Anne Perkins
my whole and sold Executor hereby giving and bequeathing unto
her all my whole Estate both personal and uall her her heirs Est.
on adm. to enjoy the same forever Everything only such gifts & Legacies
as I shall hereafter in this my last will and Testament

Item I doe give & bequeath unto Mrs Jane Maghall Epoused wife to Mr.
Archibald Maghall one red heifer aged about three years.

Item I freely give and bequeath unto Thomas Corker one yearling
the Last year calf said to be afar yearling to be delivered him
whom demand as for all the rest of my Estate bee they Goods Chattle
on Chattles on what we they bee after my June Debts and the small
above written & my funeral be satisfied & should
I freely give and bequeath unto my Lo. wife Anne Perkins my–
sole Executor as aforesaid to enjoy the same forever. In --
whereof I have hereunto my hand and this 30th of December
1668.
Signed sealed & Delivered
In the presents of us–
Bartholomew Coates
Thomas Corker
Clement Theobald
Robert Perkins
Mark
On the back of the foregoing will was thus endorsed to will
the written written will of Robert Perkins was by the oaths of Bartholomew
Coates and Thomas Corker December the fifth in common. form
M. Blomfield
